responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: OS Command Injection in runTests.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `Build/Scripts/runTests.sh` is vulnerable to OS command injection through the `TEST_FILE` environment variable.
      An attacker who can control the content of `TEST_FILE` can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed by the script.
      This is because the variable is used to construct a path without proper sanitization or validation, allowing an attacker to break out of the intended path and execute arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - Build/Scripts/runTests.sh
    classification: very promising
```<><><>codebase<><><>
```diff
--- a/Build/Scripts/runTests.sh
+++ b/Build/Scripts/runTests.sh
@@ -159,7 +159,7 @@
 shift $((OPTIND - 1))
 if [ -n "${1}" ]; then
     TEST_FILE="Web/typo3conf/ext/fluid_components/${1}"
-fi
+fi 
 
 if [ ${SCRIPT_VERBOSE} -eq 1 ]; then
     set -x

```

leads.headline: OS Command Injection in runTests.sh
leads.analysis:
The script Build/Scripts/runTests.sh is vulnerable to OS command injection through the TEST_FILE environment variable.
An attacker who can control the content of TEST_FILE can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed by the script.
This is because the variable is used to construct a path without proper sanitization or validation, allowing an attacker to break out of the intended path and execute arbitrary commands.
